Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: qtammy
Reviews.Content: For the location the price was fair. We got a room next to the lift which is not a good sign but we didn't hear any noise from it. Bedroom and bathroom were good however the lounge/kitchen area was not functional the lounge did not face the TV and it was poorly designed like part had been 'cut off' for the lift. Spa, pool steam room and sauna were a great bonus, gym is avalable to but we didn't us it. Great location walk literally accross the road into China town and the markets. Parking is available we paid $40 for 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 4+ stars”
Reviews.Author: Tuttsy
Reviews.Content: Ok, on the hotels own website they rate themselves as 4 and a half stars. Just not true. I am over hotels pretending to be what they are not. This a a boutique, apartment style hotel around 3 stars. Great for what it is. Pros Fantastic location. Bed and pillows fabulous (for me one of the main things to get right) quiet and clean if a little dated. Shower over bath with strong water flow and hot. Staff on reception helpful. Apartment style rooms spacious with tvs in both lounge and bedroom Well stocked littlekitchen for eating in. Cons Dark room as our window looked out onto other rooms. Hallway smelt dank and musty but note that the rooms were just fine. No full length mirror to prepare for those Sydney nights out. Poor bathroom mirror lighting and no make up mirror. Summary Not 4 plus stars but if you get it at a good rate you have found a really well located bargain in the heart of Darling Harbour. Walking distance to Paddy's market, Chinatown, Entertainment Centre, Convention centre, Darling Harbour. 15 to 20 min walk to Star City and we even walked all the way through the city centre to Circular Quay....that's a good walk we took over an hour to do stopping and looking. I will definately check their pricing, and if well priced, I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BROWNE07
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The location is fantastic, staff very friendly and helpful and our room was modern, clean and the bed was soooooooo comfortable. I cant understand people complaining about the arrangement to access the pool, it was easy as asking for the key to a pool gate. I would definitely consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worse hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: After getting no help with regard to finding "their" carpark and doing two laps around the block looking, I had to stop a 3rd time and park in "their check in parking"/taxi bay to ask EXACTLY where it was. This was when I was told, it's the shopping center carpark... They failed to give me a pass key to use the lift and I ended up in another wing of the same hotel that's for residents only. After getting to the residents lobby I was directed outside WITH MY LUGGAGE as the there were no porters, despite their ad, where I had to walk around the corner and back into the guest lobby. There were drunken fools drinking cases of beer on the roof in the spa and the staff refused to move them on & the pool wasn't clean. After writing to the manager, he refused to give any kind of refund or goodwill gesture and forced me to take them to the Dept of Fair Trading where I was awarded half of my money back. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning after flying in from UK. We were able to check in to our apartment straight away, The bed was comfortable and the living room spacious for us to rest in after exploring the city. No restaurant or bar but there are loads near by. We slept well with no noise issue. Location is good and the city map highlights the FREE city walking tour which is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no Bar or Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mwbarnes
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel. Our hotel â€˜roomâ€™ consisted of a lounge with TV and sofa etc. There was a small kitchen table & chairs plus a fridge, small hob, microwave, fridge and sink. The bedroom was separate and had its own TV, plus a separate en suite bathroom. It was more like an apartment. The cooking facilities could be useful, as one downside to this hotel, is that there is no Restaurant or bar on the premises. Having said that, the hotel was on the edge of Chinatown and there were plenty of restaurants and bars close by. We found the bar at the nearby 'Holiday Inn' to be very good and the breakfast was lovely (open to non residents). My only other criticism was that the hotel was linked to a noisy shopping mall with a door leading directly from the reception area and where you could hear the loud music and general shopping mall noise, although to be fair we didnâ€™t hear it in our room. The Sydney Monorail passes by this hotel and has a station at the shopping mall next door which was within easy reach BUT for some reason the train only stopped there early in the morning. If you want to use the Monorail you have to walk to the next station.

Reviews.Title: “Tough Reviewer, Great Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: trickydickfromoz
Reviews.Content: we stayed mid December 2011 for one night. the location is ideal fro exploring the Darling Harbour area. the room was clean modern with a full kitchen. No WiFi in room. pool, spa and gym for hotel guests. Value for money. one down side the roll away bed was so uncomfortable my daughter had to sleep on the couch. despite this the hotel provided a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Seasons Darling Harbour 252 Sussex Street Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights. We booked 2 bedroom apartment and were given 2 x 1 bedroom apartments. From the moment we arrived whereby we had the most wonderful female staff member check us in and give us a map to get our bearings. Our apartments were great. TV in one apartment only had limited channels but did not really care as were out so much. Fantastic location! Close to all the restaurants just a short walk over the walkway bridge to the Darling Harbour precinct. Another short walk to Pitt/George Streets for the shopping and could not resist some of the bargains on offer. Easy walk down the street to Circular Quay to catch the ferries and more eating places. The staff were so very helpful but one stands out and will definitely be writing a letter complimenting this person to management.

Reviews.Title: “For the price..Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Petal89
Reviews.Content: This was booked fairly last minute for a party of 6 of us just before Christmas and on a stay two nights get the third free deal so to begin with I had low expectations as I didn't expect anywhere decent to have availability but I have been proven wrong! The rooms we stayed in had a small kitchenette (more than adequate for the stay, including a mini bar), a separate living area with desk, flat screen tv, sofa and dining table (way too large for us to put to use!), a bedroom with one of the comfiest beds ever and an en suite bathroom which had THE most powerful shower I have come across! (A major plus for me!) The room and bathroom were clean and we loved staying here! In terms of location, yes it's right by China Town as everyone has said and it's a bit of a walk to Sydney harbour but nothing is impossible or unreasonable and it wasn't something that made a huge impact to our holiday but can imagine it being a little inconvenient for a longer stay. Only tiny little thing I would say is that getting to the rooftop pool is a bit of a hassle and on 1 or 2 occasions it took a while for reception to assist with problems in the room but overall the staff are all friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but not all I expected”
Reviews.Author: Calgarian68
Reviews.Content: This facility is great with regard to location to China Town, Darling Harbour and many attractions. We were somewhat disappointed with the cleanliness of the room, and the response time to a couple of our requests to fix a couple of minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and room”
Reviews.Author: jellybeanbee
Reviews.Content: Booked online via there website when we dropped the rental car off in Sydney - then taxied to the hotel and checked in. They organised our shuttle to the airport as well. Room was bigger than expected. Location was good, directly across from China Town and a short walk to Darling Harbour. Would stay again. Staff were good and bed was comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value accommodation and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls08
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom apartment for one night recently and very happy with the accommodation. The Seasonsâ€™ location was perfectly central to much of Sydneyâ€™s attractions â€“ Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Entertainment Centre all very close by. Reception staff were professional and helpful. Lovely and greatly appreciated to have later check-out (noon) offered to us at check-in. Travelled by train and it was an easy walk from Central Station. Easy access to other public transport if required. Arrived early and it was great to be able to leave our luggage at reception and wander off to Chinatown for lunch until check-in time at 2pm. We were delighted with our room â€“ extremely spacious for such a central location and reasonable price. We found our room very clean and tidy â€“ no issues with housekeeping for us (except see another comment below). While we didnâ€™t have a chance to use the kitchenette facilities, it looked very adequate for a longer stay if self-catering â€“ microwave, two hotplates, dishwasher, etc. Requested a quiet room and would have to say it was probably the quietest room we have ever stayed in the Sydney CBD. Had no views from our windows but that certainly didnâ€™t detract from the room â€“ the quietness was the winning feature. Even a little balcony for fresh air. Comfy bed was greatly appreciated also. Great blockout curtains as well so room was very dark and encouraged a good sleep-in. Only issue was that when we woke up at 11am (it was a late night!) we found our entrance door open - we assume it may have been housekeeping who retreated when they realised we were in room and did not shut door properly but was a concern as our wallets, camera, etc. were on a table right next to the door. With compulsory self-closers on all doors, we know we had not left it open ourselves. There was an envelope under the door with our account for quick check-out. Luckily nothing appeared to be missing but it was a little unnerving to know that someone had been in our room while we slept. Maybe we should have put the "do not disturb" sign out (but then we had found in the past at other accommodation that this is an invitation for other guests to knock on door and run...). Mentioned the open door to reception at check-out but they couldn't explain why door would have been left ajar... Enjoyed using some of the recreation facilities â€“ roof top heated lap pool and spa were just great, as was the steam room and sauna. These are located on top of the adjoining residential block with separate access keys available from reception but well worth the journey to get there (there is internal access from Seasons so not really a problem getting there) â€“ lovely views of the area from the roof top as well. Spa was not working when we were there and the concierge from the residential block was most apologetic and attempted to rectify the problem straight away â€“ was still lovely and warm to sit in spa and admire the views !! Didnâ€™t utilise the gym but it looked more than adequate with views from its full length windows (have to get separate access from residential block concierge to access gym). Overall, would highly recommend the Seasons Darling Harbour â€“ very comfortable accommodation at a reasonable price = good value. Only regret was that we were only staying one night !! Will definitely stay here again when in Sydney if the price is right !!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peatsway
Reviews.Content: A smooth check-in, the room we got was the studio room, quite generous in size with a private balcony. Mini bar fully equiped and the bed was sooo comfortable, loved it. Of course the location is great, close to all amenities, overall the price was reasonable for what they offered.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: richard s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seasons October 2011. The staff at the reception are polite and very helpful and the location is excellant. That covers the good points. The room was dirty and the housekeeping is very poor. The room decor is worn and tardy. Generally the rooms need a full refurbishment and they need to improve the housekeeping. I would not recommend this hotel and I will never stay at a 'Seasons' hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for us but a little lacking”
Reviews.Author: Kaz226
Reviews.Content: We had a business event at the Darling Harbour convention centre and this couldnt be closer but from trouble with the lift, no extra soap, even though we asked, and overall a little lacklustre. The Staff were helpful and polite, and no issues with storing luggage and booking airport transfer on checkout. Cost wasnt over the top, so would stay here again, would just bring my own soap, and hair dryer....the one in our room was damged and strands of my hair kept getting drawn into into it...ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Good but better last time and room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their holiday apartments last time and that was great. Apparently they don't manage it anymore under the new management, so that was a shame. Stayed for business this time and the hotel suites aren't too bad. The hallways are still being refurbished so it was a little shabby but rooms were a different story. Much bigger than I thought as I normally stay at the tiny Novotel rooms. Beds were quite comfy, flat screen TVs in bedroom and lounge which was convenient I found. Watching TV in bed with laptop on my lap doing this review is always good fun. Nice kitchen facilities but I ate out, reception girls were nice and broadband is fast (why can't hotels offer this for free!) Overall, a good stay, good price and location is super. Conference halls across the road and Chinatown also nearby which is always open for food. Only negative is the hallways and bathtub showers. I hate bathtubs!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: TessMoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night of the EAGLES concert in Sydney Entertainment Centre. The hotel's location is great, booking is easy online. Hope they put covers on their quilts next time :-))

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished but still a little rough”
Reviews.Author: Mojof
Reviews.Content: Location is great, the gym is actually in the building next door and of low quality. My room was refurbished but the finish and detail were poor. Rooms were large, noise can be a factor at night. Parking was very expensive and you need a ticket from reception each time you leave which is not a good system

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GingePalmy
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a one bedroom apartment on the top floor, looking out towards the harbour. The room was very comfortable, having been refurbished not long ago and was well equipped and clean. Location is fantastic- on the edge of Chinatown - not far to walk to train, monorail or bus. Very helpful and obliging staff, full marks for Seasons Darling Harbour. Only two minor things to comment on- the dishwasher didn't work and lighting was rather subdued for reading. We'd return to this hotel any time we plan to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but wont be rushing back”
Reviews.Author: Serendipitylife
Reviews.Content: We chose this location and hotel for three main reasons. A seperate bedroom for the kids so we could sit up at night and enjoy some adult time, the proximity to the monorail (on all the maps I checked it was located within the same building) as we were not confident of good weather and thirdly for the reasonable pricing. I called the hotel a few days before to enquire about the views from the rooms and was advised we were already allocated a room looking out over the chinese friendhsip garden and the ferris wheel - effectively toward Darling Harbour which I was pleased about. I had also called to ask about any car or limo service they might recommend from the aiport rather than using taxis as we have toddlers who require car seats. The hotel advised on this poin they could not assist. At check in our rooms were not ready which was ok as it was only late morning. No offer to call us when it was ready was a little disappointing. I also found a flyer in their brochure rack for town cars airport limo service! We ended up using "arrive in style" Joe was EXCELLENT and it was worth the extra money to have our kids in car seats and the lack of queuing for a taxi and safer driver was a must. We actually had a huge day of sightseeing that first day- disappointingly on a miserable sydney day we discovered the monorail station at the hotel had been closed so we trapsed the couple of block to the next arriving a little colder and damper with the kids and prams in tow. We arrived back late to the hotel and were checked into our room. To my dismay the room overlooked the entrance to Chinatown and oh boy did we hear that late at night, had it been earlier in the day I would have requested a room change but at 8 oclock my two and three year olds were stuffed! Revellers screaming at the top of their voices had me laying awake for hours at night - no fault of the hotels but something to be mindful of when booking ask for a room facing Darling Harbour. Both the bedroom and the lounge had TV's but no digital TV so no ABC kids or foxtel childrens stations so beware of any expectations in that area. Our bed was very comfortable no problems at all as cited by previous reviews however the sofa bed the kids slept on was frankly awful; the springs pushing up terribly and unfortunately they couldnt sleep well in it so four of us in a queen bed did not leave my husband or I in a good mood at all. In all honesty I guess you get what you pay for but I feel the service was very ho hum which was vastly different to the telephone contact I had with the hotel. The point of most concern to me and of note to any family travelling with young children is that I discovered all of the windows open with no screening at all - I worked this out when I discovered my 3 year hanging out of the window. Very very scary indeed. I did call reception to advise and they said they would see if housekeeping could lock them. I probably wouldnt stay here again mainly because I feel we need a bigger space and also I would choose a new location in Sydney to explore better other parts now eg the Rocks. I can see value for the money we spent and probably now better appreciate the extra touches of the hotels we have stayed in before that do go the extra mile and charge accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Upfront charge for minibar ludicrous”
Reviews.Author: margsch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at Seasons Apartments including last week, I was dumbfounded when told at checkin that $100 would be charged immediately to my credit card for minibar and refunded in maybe 5 days. I have travelled all over the world and never had this charge before, I have always paid for anything I have consumed. . If I had stolen goods in the past I could understand it but I always tell checkout what I have consumed and pay. I wonder if this practice is even legal. It should definitely be mentioned on any website so that guests planning to stay there know in advance. To complete the paperwork at checkin and then blithely be told that $100 will be charged to my credit card is wrong, an intending guest hardly has the opportunity to say well I,ll find alternative accommodation. I am very disappointed, these apartments were a favorite of mine due to position and comfort but I will be looking for alternative accommodation in future. Sydney has plenty of choice in hotels so this won,t be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and Helpful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingQuaker
Reviews.Content: We were driven to this hotel in a local limosine from the airport about 20 minutes. It is northwest in Sydney and located about four blocks from stores etc. in the city between Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The hotel was average in looks and upkeep. The rooms were older but well kept. We had everything we needed with a small refrig and microwave, dishes, coffee etc. The great thing about this hotel were the reception and staff people. They were friendly and helpful. My luggage had not arrived and they gave suggestions of where to shop that fit my budget and needs. The pool area was great with a view of the gardens below.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room but uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: MagmaTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 3 night package. Good points: Great location, close to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and George St venues, reasonable walking distance from Central Station. The room is like a serviced apartment, with separate bedroom, kitchenette, 2 TVs. Despite the Monorail directly outside, and a lift next door, the room was quiet. Staff were helpful, and the price reasonable for a stay in Sydney CBD ($95-125). Lots of good eating places nearby. Things that could be better: The booking site praised the Cloud 9 bed, but I found it to be very uncomfortale - think trying to sleep on a layer of jelly and waking up in the middle of the bed with a backache. Other suggestions: a small frypan would be helpful for the kitchen utensils. I also thought it odd that there was no dishwashing detergent - makes me wonder about the cleanliness of the crockery! Verdict: A good place to stay for the price. Because of the uncomfortable bed though, I'd think twice before staying more than one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “A great service apartment hotel within a great setting.”
Reviews.Author: marvs000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to spend a weekend night out at the city without having to spend a lot on unwanted luxuries such as concierge and valet parking. The Seasons Hotel in Darling Harbour is definitely a hotel to consider. When making accomodation enquiries, two (2) reservation officers by the name of Melissa and Walter assisted in making the night enjoyable by providing fast and prompt replies in their emails, granting my request to have a hotel room on the top floor and by providing a complimentary late check out which they've done in their own initiative to which I am very grateful for. The check-in procedures and transaction was very effective and smooth and by no time we were in our serviced apartment room. The room is pleasantly clean and the bathroom is of excellent condition. The only con/s I would have to note is the long trek to the Gym and Swim facilities. It is not within their control however. Great location as it is near the bustling centre of Chinatown, near the main streets of Sydney that provide entertainment and the room was soundproof to ensure a good nights sleep. The bed is really comfortable I must add which resulted myself and my partner in waking up later than usual as we regularly made excuses to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: busy_traveller84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Seasons Darling Harbour, for 2 nights whilst on business. The hotel is located in a great area, Chinatown, with the main CBD walking distance away i was able to get around by foot. I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful, the rooms whilst in definate need a of face lift were adequate in size, amenities and comfort. A staff member did mention to me that the hotel would be going through a refurbishment soon. If i really had to pick at things the lobby area is quite small and the gym / pool is shared by an adjoining complex and does take about 5 minutes to get to but that didn't really bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dandj69
Reviews.Content: Very dated and the room needed a really good clean. When we stepped out of the lift someone had been sick just outside our door so was not impressed. Another guest had stuck their chewing gum behind the cushion on the sofa, the kitchen area was very grotty and the crockery and cutlery were very badly stained and could not be used. The location is good but that's about all - would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of renovation!”
Reviews.Author: Mystie
Reviews.Content: Location: The location isn't bad. It's quite close to Darling Harbour if you walk past the Convention Center and the Chinese Gardens. Right next to Chinatown. This hotel was more like Seasons Chinatown than Seasons Darling Harbour to me. Room: Peeling paint, in dire need of a paint job. The so-called 'Cloud 9' bed is a lie, try renaming it 'the Hammock'. You get into bed, and roll straight into the middle. There's a kitchenette, but when I opened the drawers, ooof-you get extras- little cockroaches roaming all over the pots and pans. These friendly little critters are also found roaming round the room- behind the bed, in the bathroom, and the living area. Gym & Pool: There are NO state of the art equipment. My exercise bike at home is of better quality. The cross trainer squeaks very badly. There are 2 treadmills which you need a special key to operate, and they don't inform you about this. Pool is more like a bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing though ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Suzylou-11
Reviews.Content: I am sure this hotel was once very smart but now is somewhat tired and in need of TLC. It was a very large hotel with a rather impersonal reception - staff not always very welcoming. The roof top pool is lovely if you can be bothered to go through the procedure needed to get there and it seems to be shared with people who live in the apartments adjoining the hotel so sometimes you felt like an intruder. The kitchenette was very basic and not ideally equipped. There were 3 of us staying in the room but they had only equipped it for 2. Having said that, you don't go to Sydney to stay in your room and it was very well located for site seeing. About a 10 min walk through lovely garden to Darling Harbour which was buzzing. Here you could catch a ferry to Circular Quay or you could walk from the hotel to Circular Quay and The Rocks area.

Reviews.Title: “Seasons Darling Harbour in need of refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: mum3tas
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were tired but going to be refurbished soon. Kitchenette tiny. Had to ask fro extra cutlery and dining chair as was not in room for third person. Pull out sofa bed like sleeping on bed of nails. More China Town than Darling Harbour. Not on any direct transport routes. Mono rail went right past bathroom window so had to make sure put blind down!!! Mono rail stop not there any more. Pool and recreation amenities a hike to another hotel next door - up lift, along coridor and up lift again. Was a great pool though which we used a lot. You get what you pay for. Was average price for average accommodation. The day before we were leaving the cleaners only made beds - nothing else!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, and not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: vad1011
Reviews.Content: We selected the Seasons Darling Harbour for our five-day post New Year's Sydney visit from New Zealand based on price, location, presumed quality, and the fact that it had an outdoor pool. We paid A$199/night for a 1BR suite, which we felt represented good value during high season. That said, we ended up being pretty disappointed in our four-night stay. The room was a bit tired (see photo of bathroom vanity). The bedding seemed to be constructed of a seried of flat sheets that got tangled and pulled up in a huge annoying mess. Our Air Con stopped working at one point, as did the key card lock. The advertised rooftop pool turned out to be not quite what we had in mind. There is a pool, but it is actually located in the connecting building next door. To access it, you have to go to Level 7, and then walk down a long corridor, through the budget serviced apartments in the next building, and then take another lift to Level 18. Every time we went to use the pool, we found it chock-a-block with 19-year-old European travellers, clearly staying in the cheap serviced apartments. Suddenly $199/night started feeling pretty steep. Indeed, when we checked the website, the Season's Darling Harbour was now advertising rooms at $189/night, so the day before we left, I asked the manager if she could kindly adjust the rate for us. She said that this rate was only for rooms at the back of the building. I explained about the Air Con, the door lock, and the poor condition of the bathroom vanity and asked her to please extend this rate to us as a courtesy. She refused, and after quite a bit of back and forth, finally gave me $20 off our final night's stay. I thought this was petty and extremely poor customer service. A sign in the lift advertised re-furbishment rates of A$99/night in 2011 during the hotel's refurbishment. I would recommend this hotel at this rate, as the the access to Chinatown is amazing. It's also close to the monorail and light rail at Paddy's Markets (Chinatown stop is now closed, despite what it says on the maps.) The last straw was when we asked for a wakeup call and for a taxi to be ordered for our early start on departure day. The wakeup call came ten minutes late and the taxi hadn't been ordered. An annoying and disappointing end to an over-priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: RCF43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night, Friday, most hotels only take two nights for that price. The location is very good close to the Mono Rail, which was closed at the time but the light rail was only down one block at Paddy's market so it is easy to get around. The one bedroom unit was fine and clean. Small kitchen if you want to do your own thing. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lilyofthemyst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a few days in early October, it was my first time in Sydney. The location is amazing - 5 min walk from Darling Harbour and many restaurants in the area (right beside Chinatown). We chose this hotel as they were offering a 'stay 3 nights and save' sort of deal on their website. We believe the reason for their lower rates at the moment may be due to their recent change in management and also renovations (we were not affected by any renovation noise while we were there). We booked a 1 bedroom suite - had a kitchenette, small eating area, lounge area with flat screen TV, sliding doors which open to the bedroom that had its own smaller flat screen, and a separate ensuite. Decor was modern - could tell it had recently been changed. Windows opened fully which was a plus however at night while they were closed we could hardly here any of the traffic below. Not much of a view - this was not an issue for us as we were hardly in the room other than at night. The only issue we had was with the bathroom. The shower was over the bath - which is fine however the bath ledge was pretty high and some people with any leg/knee disabilities may have problems getting over it, especially as there is no safety rail to grab onto. We also found the shower head to be EXTREMELY low. My partner had a very difficult time, being over 6 feet. I'm 5'6 and still had a rough time, the shower head came to my chest. We did address this issue to reception and were advised they were still in the process of renovating the bathrooms. Pool/gym access is available however it is shared with the hotel next door. You have to ask reception for a special key to access it. The pool area was great - very clean and was on the roof with a pretty nice view of the surrounding areas. Service was great. The only thing we found odd was 10 minutes after we checked in we had someone knock on our door to ask if they could check if the shampoo needed to be re-filled (it didn't). My partner told the guy I was sleeping (I had been awake since 4am due to an early flight into Sydney). The guy told my partner that we should have put the DND sign on our door - fair enough - but we also didn't expect anyone to be knocking on our door after we just checked in. Why they didn't check this beforehand, I have no idea! Overall it was a good stay and we would stay again. Looking forward to see further improvements with renovations.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: tristy2010
Reviews.Content: Good service, and very convenient location in Sydney with a monorail just downstairs, and gardens and convention centre just across the road. Plenty of food options downstairs and in surrounds. Modern feel, comfortable beds, nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Service is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: save_the_koala
Reviews.Content: The location has got to be one of the best in town. Very close to chinatown and darling harbour. The monorail is located in the same building which makes it very convenient. The room was clean and service is excellent. The people at the reception desk was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Bucks night”
Reviews.Author: sub_zero2010
Reviews.Content: Nicely located near Chinatown and Darling Harbour. Rooms were clean and spacious. Would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep in that amazing bed !”
Reviews.Author: Geeful
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Seasons for 4 nights. We chose this hotel because we wanted a room with cooking facilities and a good location. We were not disappointed - restaurants surround the hotel, transportation, attractions all nearby. Our room was spacious and the kitchenette, clean and well equipped. The bed was a pleasant surprise and left the biggest impression. I normally don't sleep well in hotel rooms but this bed was so confortable that I had 4 very good sleeps. The last time I had such a bed was in a company-paid 5 star hotel room.The bedroom was nicely furnished, modern and fresh. The living area needed a little catch up but was nevertheless comfortable. The marble bathroom was spacious and I loved the L'Occitane soap and shampoo pumps. We didn't need to interact with the staff much during our stay, but when we needed to organise airport transportation, they were very friendly and helpful. Overall, it was a very comfortable stay and I would definitely stay there again. It may seem pricey for some, but we saved money on transport and food because of the choices we could make at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: D0cBr0wn
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great room - huge living area with full kitchen and plasma TV, separate bedroom with en suite. Beautifully appointed with modern furniture and decor. The queen bed was to die for - so comfy! Receiption was quick and friendly both in and out. Really nothing to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but not a fancy place”
Reviews.Author: miles_wa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights this month, as I was attending a conference at the Convention Centre. This is a great place to stay, if you want a sub five minute walk to the darling harbour. The front desk staff were OK; they didn't go out of their way to greet you when you walked in, but did smile once you got their attention. The lifts had tiled floors, both of which were cracked - most of the tiles in one seem to be broken. I stayed on the sixth floor, which placed me just above the half empty shopping centre. The smell of stale food in the hallways was very offputting. The room was OK, a comfortable bed, but the bathroom looked aged. The kitchenette, although I didn't use it, looked nice enough. I did love that I could open the window (so many hotels you can't anymore), and believe it or not, I slept well with it wide open - there wasn't much traffic mid week outside, after 10pm. I did see signs saying fitness centre, but didn't see it. They don't have a restaurant at all, so no room service. They do have around 10-12 channels on the TV. They had a mini bar in the room, and basic coffee making stuff. Summary: if you are looking for a romantic place to stay, or a clean friendly place for a family, find somewhere else. If you are simply there for business, and only sleeping in your room, and nothing more, then it's reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - couldn't outdo it”
Reviews.Author: sall13h
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite in the Anzac Day long weekend for $129 through wotif and couldn't believe it. That is usually not enough to get a half decent room, let alone a suite. We arrived at 1:30 and were checked in despite it being earlier than check in. The room was remarkable, it was more like a studio apartment with a two burner stove, mini fridge, microwave, table and chairs, leather lounge, flat screen tv and bedroom. In the bedroom was a second flat screen tv. The bathroom was marble with loccitane toiletries. The location was great, a couple of blocks towards darling harbour from the Entertainment Centre so it would be perfect for if you were seeing a show, or if you wanted a five minute stroll to the Darling Harbour restaurant precinct. You walk straight out onto Chinatown as well, which was fantastic. The hotel was only a ten minute walk from the QVB and Town Hall if that. I would stay here again and again, the hotel is not huge but has everything you need including access to a pool, sauna, spa etc and the service was great. You could not do better with regards to quality for price. It was sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hotel Standard - could do better”
Reviews.Author: ckennedy7
Reviews.Content: Good points - right next to china town and Darling Harbour. Housekeeping was adequate. Bad points - i complained about the state of the room when we checked in as it was very tired and shabby. Receptionist stated it was one of the refurbed room (i.e. it had a new tv and leather couch in it) the rest of the room was from the 70's - 80's. I asked to see 3 other rooms, all were the same so i decided to stay put in my room. To be fair i was in the back of the hotel and it was relatively quiet but had i been at the front i reckon the noise from the road would have been annoying. So the rooms are not hotel standard as they are old, shabby, not pristine, worn down. The bathrooms are nothing special and neither is the kitchen. I wouldn't go back to this hotel unless they were offering a fantastic discounted rate. I could have got a better standard of room had i stayed in a travellodge.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: pdra
Reviews.Content: We've booked a studio apartment for one night and found the room to be reasonably clean, comfortable and cozy. For just $109 (2 pax), this room is very worth it. More amenities in the room, such as slippers would be appreciated though. Location is superb - George Street is just a minute walk away, China Town's just next door and there are lots of restaurants nearby. The day-time receptionists were easy to approach and helpful. In our case, Seasons Darling Harbour provided us with complimentary car park - if not, overnight parking would have been $108.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: ritaq
Reviews.Content: while staff are more than obliging when questioned , intial response is "too bad" the hotel suite was not what was promised as far as facilities go, and it definitely needs a spruce up , the location is the saving grace , i had booked a 2 bed apt to be told it would now be 2 single bed apt which ended up being acceptable but there were not the kitchen cooking facilities that were promised .. ie fully equiped kitchen including oven and cooktop and full refrigerator ,as it was to be for our family xmas luncheon i was not able to fully prepare menu as planned , no dvd either but we did overcome these problems and location was the saving grace as chinatown across street and dept stores close by . would not reccommend ...

Reviews.Title: “Substandard pool area - overall, needs to do better”
Reviews.Author: pixie68
Reviews.Content: We had limited options when our family needed to stay in Sydney at short notice during the peak (ie: expensive) season just after Christmas, so we were grateful to find this room on a standby rooms website, we then called up and made an enquiry direct. We spoke to one staff member who quoted us a price over the phone, then when we called back an hour later to confirm, were quoted another price! However we asked they bill us at the earlier quoted rate (which was less), which they did. The hotel seems to be suffering from a bit of mismanagement. There was a high pitched noise audible in the kitchen and living area which we complained about but wasn't remedied. We had booked for 3 persons - paying an extra surcharge to use the sofa bed - but our room was made up with only 2 sets of towels. There's no in-room information guide, you we had to ask the staff at reception questions about location of laundry and pool etc. We extended our stay by another night, which we appreciated, but on the date of our oroginal check out date our key access cards stopped working and we had to go to reception to get them re-activated. On the plus side, we were given a late checkout and our questions were answered courteously. But had it not been such a busy time in Sydney, we wouldn't have stayed there the extra night. The room had a kitchenette, very basic and with only 2 of everything despite there being 3 of us staying in the room - really, not up to standard. The fridge is full of minibar drinks, which is inconveient. The pool area it must be said was the biggest disappointment. They should not promote it in their advertising. We expected to make a lot of use of this during our stay and after following the complicated instructions and traipsing through various lifts and security doors to the adjacent building, found the spa to be lukewarm and not bubbling at all. Location in heart of Chinatown and next to Darling Harbour is great - lots of options for cheap asian food. But plenty of other hotels in this location to choose from... In hindsight, we would have booked elsewhere. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “partly good, mostly bad - watch out potential guests!”
Reviews.Author: sfer3214
Reviews.Content: to start off with the good part of our stay.. our suite was lovely.. hotel well maintained.. all that you'd expect for paying $139 a night.. hotel staff friendly.. great location.. all that.. but the bad parts of the stay really do outweigh the good.. first of all the swimming pool, spa etc are in a separate building! so u need to walk across to that building after retrieving a special key to gain access.. and what a nightmare it was going into the sauna/steam room/pool/jacuzzi area.. since you are sharing with residents of the building now, and not hotel guests 1. jacuzzi too filthy to get into 2. spotted cockroach outside steam room/sauna 3. sauna had no light, so have to sit in it in darkness, and after seeing the cockroach outside? 4. sauna had no bucket/basin/cup to use to put water onto the hot rocks, so you had to get creative as to how you'd transport water from the tap to the rocks

Reviews.Title: “think twice...”
Reviews.Author: daliuniverse
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. We booked some months ago when it was the Clarion Suites and were advised late on of the change to the Seasons. The change over has obviously caused confusion to the staff, we received conflicting information about parking costs and the restaurant facility (there isn't one! - although the board basis we booked was B&B). The room was scruffy and not as clean as it could be. The toilet was not a pleasant sight. The TV was not working and there was no 'in room' hotel guide. I had to call reception on my mobile phone to get through and the safe would not work. Only plus points; the onsite laundry room and location being so close to Darling Harbour and China Town. Good restaurants and easy transport links. The hotel car park was not easy to find - if you use a Satnav make sure you set it for corner of Liverpool and Harbour Street not Goulburn Street where the hotel entrance is.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at what we were told was Clarion Suites darling harbour but found that the name had changed to Seasons. We arrived at 1.40pm to be told check in was 2pm. That's fine but when we returned at around 3pm they then needed to check if the room was ready. May be they could have done this at 1.40pm. The staff are doing there best but it seems to us that they are under so much pressure trying to do everything that things go all wrong. The room was good with a lovely view over the Chinese Garden and could see the harbour too. The room though was dirty and not well maintained with broken furniture, and just really tired. Needs some real attention but at $160 a night for a two bedroom can't expect everything perfect. We actually thought we had got off the plane in Hong Kong, Asian people everywhere but they are a quiet group and very courteous so probably a better bet than a typical bunch of loud Aussies. We were also able to arrange a late checkout at no extra cost especially when we were travelling with our two year old grandson. The busy road outside was not a problem as the sound control is very good..

Reviews.Title: “Clarion/ Choice sold to Seasons who didn't live up to clarion standards”
Reviews.Author: feb81958
Reviews.Content: I booked with Clarion/ Choice hotel several months before our trip Sept 2009. Because of the location and Clarion's reputation, and it had a kitchenette, on the day we arrived Sept 22,2009 supposely Seasons had just bought the place. None of the amenities were in place, in fact several items had been taken out. diswasher removed, but not replaced with hand dishwashing items, no towels, except 2 bath towels. There was adjacent nightclub where one night the noise continued until 4.30 am. The pool, Spa , & sauna were never available, one excuse after another. We didn't move to another hotel becuase that was the week of the Red Dust storm. The staff, were not friendly & some were even curt. I had reserved the room with my American Express card, & the card was refused at check out, we were informed that they were not set up to accept American Express . The location was good adjacent to Darling Harbor, but we would not recommend anyone to stay at Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, too bad about the noise”
Reviews.Author: rubidium
Reviews.Content: nice room with good facilities, but the noise from the adjacent nightclub was unbareable booked 3 nights, did not stay past the first.

Reviews.Title: “At best, two star!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyDs
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our holiday to Oz, I must advise that this hotel was a great disappointment. My son & his family were accommodated on the 16th. Floor whilst we were on the ninth with no way to visit them as the lifts for each were on different systems with no access between the two. The only way for us to visit was for my Sonâ€™s family to go from the 16TH floor to their ground floor & walk round to our building & then travel up to the 9th. floor of our building! We could not visit them unless they first came to us & we used their key card to access their apartment. The room my husband & I were allocated was, at best, 2 star. The dÃ©cor was tired & dirty. The carpet was stained & badly cleaned, the poor quality furniture broken &\or chipped & marked. The bathroom ceiling was stained & flaking, the tile grout mildewed & the soap dish disgusting. When I wiped up water I had spilled, the tissue was black with dirt & hairs. Obviously the cleaners only cleaned the centre of each room. Corners & edges were not touched. We were unable to use the balcony as the lock was broken & badly repaired. Using the balcony was a waste of time anyway as it opened onto other buildings. We could not even see the sky! The room my Son & family had was as bad, except for the balcony, which was accessible & had spactacular views over the harbour. The breakfast supplied was a pack of cereal, UHT milk & fruit juice in a box, with no choice given. The cereal provided for my husband & myself contained nuts, to which I am allergic. These were obtained from reception so my Son had to travel from his 16th floor apartment down to the ground floor, walk around the corner to our access, collect the packs, then trace his steps. The furniture & fixtures in the common areas, especially above the ground floor, were worn & dirty with some of the upholstery badly frayed, showing the frame underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - pity about the staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: nomadMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Generally we enjoyed our stay here for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite for the Wotif price of $99 including $10 parking and daily monorail ride. It's a great location being on the doorstep of Chinatown andi ts fantastic restaurants and the free bus up George st taking you to the city centre and circular quay. You couldn'task for better whether you are a tourist , on business or up for a shop. Our room 919 was the quiestest I've ever had in Sydney, spacious, clean and comfortable. Other comments suggest the hotel rooms are inconsistent in their cleanliness and general upkeep but ours was immaculate and serviced everyday wby lovely , friendly cleaning staff who couldn't do enough for us. But the same cannot be said for the front desk staff in reception. Fawlty Towers eat your heart out . They are truly hopeless and made this fairly even tempered and chilled retiree want to jump over the counter and give several of them I encountered over the four days, a good slapping. Blank looks,shrugs, disinterest and misinformation about parking and checkout procedures were all really frustrating and disappointing. This hotel chain (Choice HotelsI believe) need to get their act together and act upon the myriad of complaints about front of house staff and management already voiced on this site, as well as their couldn't care less attitude to customer's and their needs. Would I stay again? Probably if I could get a bargain price because now I know all the tricks to parking, I'd request my 919 room and I'd know not to rely on reception staff for anything.

Reviews.Title: “"The worst place I have ever stayed"- and i've been everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: Dougeli
Reviews.Content: When I write reviews I always try to make at least one positive comment even if the positives are limited. Unfortunately I could not find a single positive aspect to comment on at the Clarion Suites, it was all "extremely" negative. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment, supposedly the "Junior Penthouse". We arrived at the hotel to find the 5 minute check-in carpark at the front was full, after our 4th lap of the block and 45 minutes later the same cars were still in the carpark, due to utter frustration and a screaming baby in the back I decided to park on the footpath with my hazard lights on whilst I checked in. We were given directions to the Hotel carpark and told we could check in after we parked- the directions given were wrong and after another 30 minutes we finally found the carpark which had absolutely no signage whatsoever to indicate it was the Clarion carpark. After check in we made our way to our room and found we had to swap elevators on the 11th floor because the one in the lobby didn't go as high as the 13th floor where we were staying???. We arrived at our door to find that the lock and door handle were half hanging from the door and the keys wouldn't open it. When we finally got the door open we were almost knocked over by the hideous stench coming from inside- a mixture of cigarette smoke (non smoking room), stale alcohol and rotting food. To go with the stench we found the room to be disgustingly filthy, stained carpets, grubby seats you wouldn't let your dog lie on that seemed to be encrusted with something white like vomit-or worse, alcohol and/or vomit on the walls. The worst thing of all was to find that the toilet in the main bathroom had been used, the lid was up and there were pubic hairs on top of the bowl. We immediately complained to the front desk and demanded another room only to be told the Hotel was totally booked out, they offered to come up and look at the room and clean up as best they could. Whilst we waited for the staff to arrive we attempted to find another 2 bed (or 2 x 1 bed) apartment in the city but we were unable to due to the fact the City to Surf was on the next day and everything was booked solid. We decided to open a bottle of wine to cheer ourselves up a little, I opened the cupboard to find there was 1 wine glass between the 4 of us, 2 coffee cups, 3 plates and 2 filthy glasses. What a joke- it appears there was a party in the room the night before and everything had been trashed, the room should not have been let out for the night and was only done so because they had no other rooms to move us to. No one should have been subjected to the filth of that room let alone our 5 month old baby. How they could call this their "Junior Penthouse" is beyond me, I have slept in overnight sleeper trains in Vietnam that are cleaner and of a higher standard than this place. When we spoke with the assistant manager the next morning we got the feeling that she didn't really care that we were upset and that it was just the norm to have their guests complaining about the poor service and standards that are provided in this dump. We were told that we would be contacted by the higher management, but this never happened. My response to that is that I now intend to take the issue further and I will NEVER EVER EVER EVER stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful service, bed not so comfy, but enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: mumdadandbub
Reviews.Content: location: great, attractions such as the aquarium, wildlife world, the darling habour, paddy's market, china town and transport all a short walk away. Room: my 8 mth old, husband and I stayed in a one bedroom suite. the bedroom was on the smaller side and the porta cot had to be set up in the living area, but this didn't affect our stay. the bed wasn't comfortable, felt like we were sinking in it. heating didn't really work but the staff at reception were more than happy to provide extra blankets. no dishwasher but this didn't bother us at all. a tv in living area and 1 in bedroom was great especially when bub was asleep in the living area. furnitute is on the modern side but could do with an update as lounge and bed are pretty much worn out. service: the staff always responded to our queries in a friendly and helpful manner and were prompt in attending to our needs. overall, the staff were helpful and we enjoyed stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: deniseacole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special when it comes to amenities; but as far as location and comfort goes, it's definitely right on the money. Conveniently located between Chinatown and Darling Harbour, you'll never run out of things to do. And our room was unbelievably quiet, considering we faced the main roads (Harbour and Goulbourn). The only thing that really disappointed me about this stay was the fact that our room phone was broken and was never replaced/ fixed regardless of our several complaints. However, the staff members were all very helpful. Needless to say, we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: HillBill2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in Darling Harbour.Â  Our apartment was very comfortable especially the bed.Â  While we did not have a view everything else was great and in easy walking distance of eating out, markets, trains etc. We would definetly stay there again.Â  The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room facilities”
Reviews.Author: elm01au
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work conference as the hotel I usually stay at when travelling to Sydney was unavailable within my allowable rate. I would consider staying here again either for business or leisure. The location was great. Plenty of options of restaurants in Chinatown and a very short walk to Cockle Bay Wharf which has a range of quality restaurants on offer. Would have been a perfect spot for sightseeing around Sydney or seeing a concert at the Sydney Entertainment Centre. As it was, its a good location for the Sydney Convention Centre (although I must admit that other hotels are closer, the advantages found staying here more than made up for the extra five minutes walking). The room itself was very quite, after pulling out the microwave power cord I had a great nights sleep on a comfortable bed in a dark room. As noted by many others the bed was amazing. The other facilities of the serviced apartment style were great even though I didn't get a chance to use them. We all left over bags at the hotel on the last day of the conference and had no problems. The room was locked at the time we returned and we had to hand over the card we were given before they got them so they may have added additional security after the problems another reviewer had. The disadvantage of my room compared to some of my colleagues was that the kitchenette/lounge was not separated from the bed (hence the reason for disconnecting the power). On the other hand when I have friends in the room after going out to dinner there was plenty of room for us to sit around watching TV. I also had trouble access the pool and gym in the neighbouring hotel. For some reason, even after getting the appropriate access from the front desk, I was unable to get up to the relevant floor. The other problem is that after returning the pass it means that you have to outside and back around to the Clarion entrance as you can't use the lifts. I also wasn't a fan of the liquid soap in the shower. The products themselves were very good but I do like having a bar of soap to wash myself and given that I was staying at a hotel hadn't thought to bring on from home. The bathroom itself was very clean but could have used some slight repairs. Overall it was one of the most comfortable stays I have ever had. Happy to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: DanielTang
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1-bedroom apartment and i gotta say, my wife and I are very satisfied with the apartment. The location of the apartment is superb, its of walking distance to most of the city's attraction. Rooms are very new and clean but I suppose the only improvement that we would like to see is that probably the staff could be more knowledgeable when we(as tourist) requires their advice on direction. Eg. We wanted to go to the Paddington market from our apartment and the receptionist told us that its a mere 15 mins walk.. and guess what we walked and walked based on the map and direction guided, we only reached there after 45 mins. Other than that, this hotel apartment is totally valued for money and I would definitely return again. cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2001
Reviews.Content: The room was really spacious however there was a funny smell in the room. Not sure if there was recent refurbishment however as i was only staying for 2 nights, it was not really an issue as I was out of the room most of the time. I found the staff to be really helpful with regards to directions and restaurants. They were really friendly. I was slightly surprised by the absence a a dishwasher as all my previous stays in a service apartment has provided one. I also found it slightly amusing that there was no rubbish bin in the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: mrLoveJ
Reviews.Content: Alot of people put there bad stay on the hotel, hotel is nice great location and staff were friendly! all im saying is dont believe everything you read! people get personal when they have a little bad experience and take it out on hotels and there staff. all in all i had a great stay it was cheap for a hotel in this location! Staff made a few mistakes but tried there hardest.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: overstayer
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment at this hotel. it was nice and comfortable overall. We found that upon check in a few of the staff members did not know the area very well as we asked for places to dine etc etc. Also the directions we were given to access our room which was in a totally different building were very confusing and we got lost a few times. The room was very clean and tidy and well presented however the furniture is in need of upgrade. The View we had from the room was 5star as it overlooked Darling Harbour. I would recommend for anyone to stay here once the furniture is upgraded and the reception staff have more knowledge of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “cloud 9 beds a joke, worst bed”
Reviews.Author: KathyQueensland
Reviews.Content: After spendind countless hours searching the net for accommodation in Sydney for our 12 night family holiday , I finally decided on Clarion Suites due to their "Cloud Nine beds" and location. The location really was great. The monorail was right at the building and very convenient. We could walk very comfortably to many shops, rail stations and attractions, and of course China town. When we checked in we were told we could not check into our apartment as it had been damaged the night before from previous guests. We were put into two1 bedroom apartments till the next day. Although an inconvenience it was ok for 1 night and the beds were so comfortable. We went out on our first day of being tourists and the staff transferred all our bags and food from fridge to our apartment. They were very helpfull and polite. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 16th floor with excellent views from 2 verandahs. The room itself was large and yellow. It certainly needs a paint job. A few nicks and scrapes on the walls but no big deal. We had no frypan or toaster in the room but they were quickly sent up to usby friendly staff . The main problem we had was the "Cloud 9 bed". Not in the 2 bedroom apartments we were told after we went to our room and sat on the bed. It was more uncomfortable than a bed in a budget style roadside motel .After reading all the Clarion Suites web sites bragging about these great beds and intending to stay for 12 nights we wanted a comfortable bed. we were told they were only in the 1 bedroom apartments not the 2. What a rort. Nowhere in any of the Clarion advertising does it say 1 bedroom only. I have included a response from management re a previous guest review about the "Cloud 9 beds" Management response from CSDHMGT, Manager (Management representative) Jan 1, 2009 "We are glad you enjoyed the Cloud 9 beds as it was the very basic fundamentals of accommodation we felt was essential. This was basically a 5 star bed without the price tag to the room rates. It is quite rare to experience this bed outside of the 5 & 6 star Hotels. This is a sign of things to come in our refurbishment..." When I contacted management I was told they could not do anything about it and did i want to move back into two 1 bedroom apartments that had the cloud 9 beds. Yeah right, we had 2 kids for 12 nights. Not a good idea. He said he could help us move to a different hotel if I did not like where I was. The whole "cloud 9 bed" thing is very misleading and dishonest, the bed was so bad to sleep in. I spoke to management re the 100% guarantee satisfaction or refund of 1 nights accommodation flyer in the room and was told "next time you come to Sydney we will give you 1 night free. What a joke. we came for 12 nights and spent a fortune, do you think we would come all the way back for 1 night free. The 100% satisfaction guarantee is a lie also. We were very disapointed with the response from management. Why do they put this advertising in the room and on websites? It's wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dubadelic_69
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru wotif.com after reading most of the reviews on tripadvisor. We agree that the location is great, and the room is a nice size for the price. We had the suite including a little kitchenette and lounge room, on top of the std bedroom/ensuite. The hotel is located at the new Dixon 1 shopping bit, outside of Dixon St Chinatown. Great location for chinese food and Paddy's Markets, and the monorail station is in the same building. Also great access to Darling Harbour, Harbourside. A decent walk to QVB & Circular Quay though. We recommend the Spanish Club and Satsuma (in #1 Dixon) for dinner! The room was mostly clean, a few scuff marks around though. We liked the kitchenette so we could save money on breakfast, but when we went to cook, we were missing the frypan and some utensils (one fork btw us just won't do!). And the first night the internet wasn't working when my husband went to use it. We didn't try after that. Also, our room was on the chinatown side and was a bit noisy at night. However, the location made up for it, and we had fun walking to Sydney attractions. Don't expect 5 star, but it was comfortable enough for our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Georgie71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 days to spend Xmas with my family. I was hesitate in booking the hotel due to some negative reviews. I have to say that the hotel wasnt the best i have stayed at but it also wasnt the worst. I agree with other reviews that the hotel is in a fantastic location but i also agree with the fact that it is a bit dirty. Some of our appliances were broken and could have been quite dangerous as we had our 15mth baby with us, and the hotel also can be quite confusing as there are two parts to the hotel. Would i stay here again?.......for the location and price..... i probably would.....would i recommend it?.......as long as you dont mind a few things not working and hard beds......yes

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: NilesPortMacquarie
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Southern Cross on Harbour. It is perfectly situated near Darlilng Harbour and the top end of Dixon Street in Chinatown. Walking distance to all the facilities including Paddy's Market, Restaurants, shopping, Entertainment Centre, theatres, There is a mono rail station in the building next door and it is short walk to Central Station and the Light Rail system. We had a one bedroom suite which included lounge room and kitchen area which is perfect if you want to do some cooking but certainly not necessary as there is an abundance of eateries nearby. The price was reasonable and we were very happy with the facilities and the staff. Would recommend highly if you are looking for an apartment style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & dirty - avoid!”
Reviews.Author: TravelrocksNz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked to stay here in one of the hotel suites for 6 nights in July. We were expecting to have views of Darling Harbour as per some other reviews but we had a view of a road in Chinatown as that is essentially where this hotel is. We felt like we were staying on the road, it was so noisy. The room was dingy and dirty with hardly any lighting, the fridge wouldn't close and the toaster didn't work. The furniture in the lounge looked like it was from the 70s. The only good points were the clean new bathroom and the new comfy cloud 9 bed in the bedroom. The worst bit was being woken up early the next morning to the sound of drilling. It was so noisy it sounded like it was in our room. We kept calling reception and they kept telling us what time it was going to stop but it never did stop and the times kept changing depending on who we spoke to. The reason for the drilling is because they are renovating a shopping centre on the ground floor which was mere metres below our room. This wasn't made known to us by the company we booked with. When we couldn't stand it any longer, we got moved to one of the apartments in the separate building but this was even more dirty with food on the floor, a broken chair, filthy couch and a new noise to contend with; the noise of the lifts plus the noise of the drilling. We gave up, cancelled the rest of our stay and moved elsewhere. We won't be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: bileneblu
Reviews.Content: I have been to Sydney many times but this is the first time I have stayed at the Clarion suites Darling Harbour. I decided to stay in an apartment/hotel as my stay was for 6 nights. I thought the rate was quite reasonable for the particular area - across the road from the Entertainment Centre, Darling Harbour & Chinatown and it is also a close walk from Central Station. Well the room itself was quite decent - well presented and it has a seperate living room so it kinda felt like a home away from home - it features a kitchenette and a marble bathroom. The staff there were friendly. I would definately consider staying there again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “good value, fantastic loaction”
Reviews.Author: fionaanddeb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our Travel Agent in the UK and thought we had got lucky because it was a great location for an even better price. However once we read some of the reveiws on this site we had started to regret our decsion and even wanted to change our booking but we were not able to. When we got to the hotel we found the staff to be happy and helpful - they held our bags until our room was ready. When we got to our room, our bags had been already taken up and we were pleasently suprised - but then we found old food left in the microwave and the curtains looked a bit grimey. We called downsatirs and they very quickly took us to another room which was great! Clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the shower was strong and hot! We had mentioned that the fridge had been turned up to high and several bottles of water had frozen and cracked - again the The staff were very helpful and removed the items from the fridge. When we got home we found that we had been charged for $200 items that had been in the fridge ( the drinks that had been removed). We called them and they immediately refunded the charges and apoligised for the error. So yes - there are some problems at this hotel, but show me a hotel that doesn't have its problems! the difference here is that the staff are helpful and go out of thier way to find soloutions to problems that may be caused by higher up management. decisions. If you want a place that is close to everything ( including a monorail stop!), and a place where the rooms are comfortable and the staff are friendly - then this is the place for you. In fact, we have even booked another stay there in 6 months time!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: brrmm
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Wotif. We stayed here for 7 nights, 2adults and 2 children (10 & 8yrs) in a 1 bedroom suite with sofa for kids. OK it needs to be stated that this establishment is in two very separate buildings. The hotel (with the 1brm suites) and a separate adjacent building with the apartments. That doesn't seem to be clear anywhere. The pool is in the apartment buiding and to get there from our hotel it's a quick little jaunt thru the unfinished shopping plaza, out onto the street, and then into the apt bldg. Keep this in mind. However during the course of our stay (later rather than sooner) we found a way on our 7th floor by following directions to the "executive rooms" and catching their lift to the pool - no outdoors that way. They didn't tell us this way so presumably they don't want anybody using it. Location: At the entrance to the Dixon St mall in Chinatown with some great eating places. Not good for us as our fussy kids curled their noses up at it all. About 10 min walk to Town Hall Rail Station, and about 15min walk to Central Railway. Only 3-5 mins walk to World Square Shopping Centre, and enormous shopping complex with full-service Coles supermarket. I'll just add here that you're still in chinatown so it is like walking around in downtown Hong Kong, fun. MONORAIL station within the hotel/apt complex, very handy. Room: 1 bedroom suite with fold down sofa. Bar fridge (broken, leaking constanly), sink, dishwasher, 2burner cooktop, microwave. Wotif stated only one child in this room, so I rang hotel who advised it is quite OK and suitable for 2 small children, just put a remark in the bkg, which I did. When I followed up with hotel later about another matter they were rude and told me my bkg was "illegal". Long story short......they said they would honour the bkg (oh big thanks!)....I said, maybe train your staff with your product. The sofa bed was atrocious! Yes even for a kid! The base was a canvas trampoline thingy with no support underneath, but with a thin foam mattress on top. How even 1 adult could sleep on it is beyond belief. My kids kept rolling together and ending up either fighting in the midst of night or not sleeping well at all. Very disappointed. We ended up with kids in with us most of the time. Having said that, our bed was a dream, literally. Best bed I've ever kipped in. Everything in the rooms is tired/old/dated and in need of refurbishment. 2 TVs, of which only 1 worked. The bedroom wall mounted TV was only tuned into 1 station. We tried to fix, they tried to fix, but there's no fixing that one! Very disappointing. I might just add abouth the shower over bath combo. The bathtub is narrow at the bottom so it's really difficult to stand when showering. Cause your feet are at an angle it gets mighty slippery (our kids slipped over several times), they need to put in some grips there. Also the bath is high to climb into. Parking: Valet only at the cheap rate. That means you must hand they keys of your expensive car over to the 18yo manning the front desk. The car park is such a secret hideaway that you can't even drive your own vehicle to even accompanied by the 18yo. Very disappointing. And just where do you stand with your car insurance on this one? Overall, we had a wonderful time in Sydney and the hotel was OK. A few things need attention though.

Reviews.Title: “Huge apartment and views of Darling Harbour!!”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: Always preferred serviced apartments to hotel rooms but this apartment was great, spacious and cheap. Was there for a bucks night. Checked in, not much of a lobby but shopping centre we crossed through looks like it is still not finished. Very confusing but similar to casino resorts I guess. Staff was good enough to give us a tour of the centre which apparently will become a resort when a gaming, entertainment club comes in...wouldnt want to know how much it will cost for an apartment then !! Monorail station in the building which was handy and the apartment was mixed in with residents which was great for privacy and made it feel like home!! We got told of a complimentary upgrade to the junior penthouse and it was great. Views of Darling Harbour and the gardens was magnificent. Huge bathroom and room and very modern for 4 star. Will definitely come back and not worth the reviews it got !!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and close to everything but dirty”
Reviews.Author: CanTravelFam
Reviews.Content: Well the price is great for this hotel/apartments, but the condition of the unit one lot of our family group stayed in was not great, we have young baby whom of course crawls and after crawling about on the carpet in the room the tops of his feet were black!!!!!!, not nice at all The other unit our group stayed in was a world above the first one, better fitted out and cleaner to look at If seems as if it is luck of the draw at this hotel The only issue with unit 2 was that there was only 1 key available for the unit and we were on different floors and of course you can only get to a different floor if you have a key with the remote for that floor, when travelling in a family group as we were this was a real pain as we had to work out how to get back into the rooms every time people went out! Understand the security issue but don't understand why 2 keys were not available like standard in hotels! We won't be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation”
Reviews.Author: margsch
Reviews.Content: The apartment was clean and spacious, it was well equipped with micrwave oven, cooktop, fridge, separate dining and living room as well as a large bathroom and spacious bedroom. I liked the fact that I didn,t have to get up and attend a set time breakfast, and was able to iron clothes in the apartment. The position is great with a monorail stop in the building and light rail only a 3 minute walk away. Directly across the road from Dixon street, the Chinatown, I was able to buy food or eat out any time. My room faced a central atrium and while I didn,t have a view, I was grateful for the quiet this offered as I believe the outside rooms receive a lot of traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but okay”
Reviews.Author: blueflier
Reviews.Content: The Trendwest Suites have been bought by Wyndham Resort and the property is going through signage issues, which might be the reason why we wandered around Goulburn and Wentworth before we found the place. Once we were there, however, there were no issues with check in or our room. The one-bedroom room is nicely updated with two televisions (one in the living area that has cable channels, and one in the bedroom with the usual five stations). The dining area was nice, and we had a Juliet balcony that overlooked a snippet of Hyde Park (mostly other buildings, however). The kitchen is quite small -- there is a microwave and two cooktop elements, and a small fridge. Toaster and kettle were also included. There was not a freezer, oven, dishwasher or washer/dryer. Laundries are available in the apartments on floors 3, 7, 11 and 15. I didn't feel like carting dirty laundry up and down floors, so did not use. The kitchen is outfitted with utensils, dishes and the like, but I was less than impressed with the cleanliness of the cookery, and scalded everything before using. It appears as if the new owners are going to be selling some of the apartments as timeshared units. All in all, the location is nice (we were able to walk into the city, to Central Railway and Town Hall, and also to the Sydney Cricket Ground, but all were a bit of a walk...FYI), the rooms were clean for the most part, and the conveniences were quite good for the $140 AUD average per night we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Sun standard at Trendwest Suites, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromTod
Reviews.Content: During a month long trip to Aussie I have to say that this hotel was a real "low" in the holiday.
