The rooms had been recently refurbished are were okay but the staff and the standard of cleaning let the whole place down. There are limited laundry facilities with one washing machine and dryer on level 5 and another on level 7. I spent literally hours racing around trying to get laundry done with washing in a machine on one level and drying on another level and to make matters worse only 1 lift working!! Racing up and down the fire exit staircase was a welcome workout as the hotel advertised a gym but didn't provide one!!! A couple of the staff were extremely rude - I would give this one a miss if I were to go again.

Reviews.Title: “We were really happy with Trendwest Suites”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethS
Reviews.Content: We wanted a suite hotel for our 6 night stay in Sydney at the end of 3 months away - needed some space! I was a little concerned with some of the earlier reviews here on Trip Advisor but most of the complaints had to do with construction noise so I went ahead and booked. We were really happy with our accommodation - although we did ask to be moved to a higher floor due to ground floor construction noise (which is almost done) - our suite was great - a very functional kitchen (the addition of a plunge coffee pot would have been even perfect but they claim they're coming - in the meantime they supply instant coffee and there is a kettle, big toaster, microwave, 2 electric burners and a frig). A flat panel TV in the bedroom and living room; hi speed internet (for a fee). We used the laundry facilities several times and never had a problem with availability. We liked Sydney so much we rearranged our schedule and returned to the hotel for 3 additional nights. The location was great for us - we walked to Darling Harbour, the Opera House, etc and a cab ride back was reasonable. Front Desk Staff was helpful - we checked our bags there for 5 nights when we went to Cairns for a dive liveaboard - all was well upon our return. For the price ($160US and $195US for our two different stays) and the facilities and the location - it's a great bargain for Sydney, I think

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing end to a wonderful trip to Oz.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeysUncleYorks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our final stop in Australia, before we flew to Bangkok and then London, on a 5 week trip. My parents and I had travelled to Singapore, Cairns, Brisbane, Sunshine Coast, Adelaide visiting relatives and had stayed in some excellent accommodation (see separate reviews). After reading previous reviews I was slightly nervous of the Clarion Suites but hoped things may have improved. We arrived late on Thursday 22nd February 2007 to be greeted with the news that our 2 bedroom apartment was unavailable and that we had been put in two 1 bedroom apartments. There was no explanation offered as to why and when I asked for one they couldn't come up with a reasonable answer considering the accommodation had been booked for 8 months! They tried to sell it as an upgrade and said the rooms were next to each other. The apartments turned out to be at the opposite ends of a long corridor and neither had washer/drier facilities, essential on a long trip. Only the 2 bedroom apartments had this!! The hotel provided "facilities" for the rest of the guests. This was 1 washer and 1 drier situated in an non-airconditioned room off the basement car park. The drier was broken for the whole of our stay which meant wet clothes drying around the apartments. The apartments themselves were simple and clean but in desperate need of some TLC. This goes for all the common areas as well. It is certainly not a 4* establishment. Our complaints were never resolved during our stay despite complaining several times over the 4 days we stayed there. We submitted a letter of complaint to the travel company when we returned. Apparently they have also received several others. We did not allow this to spoil what was a fantastic first trip to Australia but it was a disappointing end. Take my advice, spend your money somewhere else until this hotel is sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: kathyUpwell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trendwest Suites in February for 5 nights and sometime you think wish I had not read reveiws due to some negitive comments. Myself and my husband could not fault the place. Our room which was a one bedroom studio was clean with the added benefit of a small kitchen area. There was also a double shower which we prefer to a bath any day. There was a laundry room on our floor which was excellent. Nearby was plenty of eating places. The location was excellent as well. So I recommend the Trendwest suites and enjoy yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at Trendwest Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mez2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Sydney. I was very impressed with the Trendwest Suites. I first stayed in a studio suite for four days and then in a one bedroom apartment for a further 8 days. The rooms were fully refurbished, clean and very comfortable, especially the beds! The only problem was the renovation that was going on, which could be a little noisy first thing in the morning, but that's almost finished. On all occasions the staff were friendly and helpful and booked several trips and flights for me. The telephone line in the first room I stayed in did not work, so the hotel kindly let me use their broadband connection free of charge. It is a shame the STC bistro isn't open for dinner, as the breakfasts are good and the staff very friendly. However, it's only a short walk to nearby restaurants. I'll certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful”
Reviews.Author: Caz09
Reviews.Content: We where a party of six and booked three rooms 9 months prior. Upon arrival we were allocated rooms on three different floor. Upon entering our room we were met with the quite distinct smell of damp. The room was dirty and the furniture was old and broken. The bedroom didnt get any better, they had pushed two single beds together, again the bedding was damp. The kitchen area was no better upon opening the dishwasher was met by two large cockroaches running around the base. We complained to reception and asked for a move, and were met with "Tough Im Only the night porter wait while morning". It was the same for the rest of my family. We were moved the following day, yes the room was better but again the room was dirty and the furniture was old. I have to be honest this is the worst hotel I have stayed in. Staff are totally unhelpful and its as though they are fed up of hearing complaints. My advise is avoid the hotel at all costs. Our complaint along with photographs is now with our travel agent whom we booked through.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellagirl11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two friends, in a one bedroom apartment., as our first choice of hotel was booked out The hotel was better than expected - the reviews I had read here made me wonder whether I was going to get a dodgy old apartment. I booked online, as it was $20 cheaper per night than booking through the hotel on the phone. The apartment had been recently refurbished, and was a perfectly adequate size, with everything that we needed for the weekend. The bathroom was off the bedroom, and quite large, although there was no bath. The front reception was quite small and had not been refurbished (I guess that they are still getting to that), but the staff were quite helpful. We did have to ask twice for towels (after housekeeping came the second day and took the old ones without replacing them), but they were very apologetic and brought them up straight away. The hotel is in a great location - between the CBD and Surry Hills. I recommend a drink at the Hollywood Hotel (about 500 metres away).

Reviews.Title: “Simple, yet comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aurorapotter
Reviews.Content: I had expected the worse - but instead got better then what I had bargained for. I went there with 2 other of my girlfriends and enjoyed the room straight away. Check-in and out was fast and simple. The room was great. No problems. Bed comfortable - all essentials readily available. And privacy was ensured. A bonus was that all major locations were only a short walk away. I highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont like chinese food prepare to walk”
Reviews.Author: Beenie
Reviews.Content: A great looking aparthotel form the reception. Rooms really spacious. A dishwasher but with only two of everything in the cupboards defeated the object of having one. View was of other part of the hotel and the sound of the monorail was fun or the waste being collected in the early hours of the morning with alarm sounding was great fun (not). If like us you did not like chinese food then forget it. This is in chinatown, was not told that by our travel agent, so had togo out to eat each evening. Darling harbour wonderful. Sydney harbour not so nice at night. A great value hotel if you can get a better view and away from the road. Note Swimming pool is not in the hotel but it's sister one around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: GraeHo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2006. I paid Â£49 a night, which is less than you would pay for Premier Lodge or Travel Lodge in the UK. For this you get a I bedroom apartment. The rooms had basic amount of furniture which would appear to be the original items form when the building opened ie about 8 years old. The hotel is currently undergoing a refurb, and I did have a look at the completed rooms. I have to say they looked a bit better than ours as it was all new, but it really was a paint job and up to date chrome microwave and kitchen stuff rather than white but thats all. The hotel is located in a excellent position to get around. Easy for CBD, Chinatown and the Central Station and Gay district if thats your thing. The staff were helpful, thought to be honest we didnt really need their help to get round Sydney as it is easy to navigate. We didn't have a problem with road noise as our room was 8 floors up and our bedoom didn't face on to the roads (room 839 or 836 i can't remember) . I would guess that if you had a front facing room it might be noiser, but you are in a city centre so that has to be expected. The gym was not open at the time, as it was on a floor that was being refitted, thought i did sneek a peek, and found it consisted of a cross trainer ,cycle and running mill and shower. I don't think you would want to share the gym as it was so small. The picture on the web site I think relate to the old gym, which is now the contracter's work office on floor 13. The only gripe we had was the fact the TV was broken, and took two days to repair. Apparently, as part of the refurb digital TV is being installed and they are having teething problems with it. I would not say the place was 4 star but more like 3 star but for less than Â£50 a night for a room thats good value. Other than that we found the room spacious, clean and suitable for most people. I would have no problem recommending this place to stay in. I would warm any guest staying that the premises is being refited and the builder 's tend to start work at 8.30am, but this didn't intrude in our stay. If ,however, you like you like to sleep in late, this may not be suitable for you. I hope you find this review useful and enjoy any stay you may have here and in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BallFamilyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews posted early 2006 and very nearly moved our booking to a different hotel which would have been Â£500 more expensive (we would have needed 2 rooms). We're so glad we didn't. The four of us arrived in Sydney very early on the Monday morning, 2 adults, 17 yr old son and 14 year old daughter. We made our way to the hotel and as it was only 8am, asked if we could leave our cases and get exploring. However we were told that our room was ready and waiting. We showered had a cup of tea and was out refreshed and ready to see what Sydney had to offer by 9.30am! The only niggling problem was we were on the 17th floor but we told the kids the balcony was off bounds and soon got used to the idea. The 2 bedroomed apartment was ideal. Adults double with en suite, the kids in a twin with their own bathroom next to their room. The laudry room was fab.....everything washed and ironed on the last day ready for week 2 of our Australian adventure. Locality was great. We were at the back, not much view but that didn't give us a problem. We could walk across the road to Darling Harbour or walk up a couple of streets to catch a train from Town Hall to Circular Quay. We didn't use the pool, far too much to see and do in Sydney and around. The apartment was clean and serviced daily including fresh towels if needed. The space in the apartment was brilliant, especially having 2 teenagers! We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: tempest26
Reviews.Content: The good: Great location, just around the corner from Hyde Park. Can walk to Oxford Street if the bar scene is your thing. Convenient store right next door, shopping areas and Chinatown within walking distance. Nice Spacious rooms, even has a decently equippied kitchen with tools, pot pans, utensils and china. The kitchen is probably the best thing about the room, it's more like being in a one bedroom apartment, so if you are here for a long time then it's more homely than a normal hotel room. Having a living room is great for having guests over. Bathroom is a good size, nice and clean looking and got all the things you need and more. The Bad: The bed is the most uncomfortable I have slept on in god-knows-how-long. Just couldn't get a good night sleep at all. Super flat pillows and paper thin comforter didn't help. Temperature in room was impossible to control, actually don't even know if the Thermostat really worked, it didn't seem to make a difference what I turned it to. TV worked ok at the beginning but one day just didn't work anymore, asked the reception and they said it would take 2 days before I get it back. Had 2 fire alarms during the one week I was there, around 5-6 pm both times. The staff seemed to think it was quite normal I wonder if this is a frequent occurrence here. No internet, not even if you want to pay extra charges. The rooms here just aren't equipped with cable or DSL. Had to walk 2 blocks to a decent internet cafe. Tried stealing people's bandwidths on wi-fi but no success in this building. Overall: Not bad.... don't know if I would come back the very next time. Might have to try out 1 or 2 other places first to see if there are better places out there for the same price. Don't think it would be impossible if you look hard enough. But otherwise it is not a completely bad place to settle for if you think the price is good because at least the location is very ideal, and the space is good for long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean And Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: tf1803
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bed apartment between 3 of us so it worked out good value for money.It was clean and was serviced every day,clean,nice sized rooms,decent kitchen and our own laundry room with washer and drier which was a godsend. I would stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “OK and Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my partner and two very young children. Apartment very large but outdated and worn. Facilities not good a run down roof top pool and not even a toilet in reception. It was adequate accommodation located opposite Darling Harbour but pricey for what it was, I agree with other comments you would find much better in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious but in need of upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were also confused over the name change, our shuttle dropped us off at the wrong place because of the name change which has changed three times in a year apparently. Check-in is not until 3pm which is unacceptable if you have had a long flight and in desparate need of sleep. We were given use of the gym to shower and change - now that needs upgrading, only one shower worked, I tried to use the hairdryer and it fell of the wall, it wasn't even wired in! At this point we were worried about what our room would be like so in the five hours we had to wait we checkout other accomodation just incase! Our room was very spacious, huge bathroom, adequate cooking facilities if they were needed. However the furniture is in dire need of an upgrade. But overall very comfortable. Building work was taking place but we were advised prior to our departure and told that this would happen between the hours of 9 and 4 which it did and we were always out.

Reviews.Title: “Major refit”
Reviews.Author: janep56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apts in February and the first thing that confused us was that the name has changed ..they are now known as Trendwest suites. The whole hotel is in the middle of a major refit. We had a studio apt and it was excellent very clean and well equipted The staff on reception were extremely helpful and very knowledgeable Would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere to stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our two bed apartment way back in june 05, however when we arrived at the southern cross we were told it was not available! we were given two one bed apartments not even connecting (they were on opposite sides of the corridor)-this was not at all suitable for a family of four ( 2 adults 2 children). We complained and were given a 2 bed apartment the next day (very inconvenient not being able to unpack). This apartment was very scruffy, badly chipped walls,dirty soiled soft furnishings etc.I'm sure this hotel was fabulous when new, but it has just not been maintained.Also we saw a dead cockroach in the hall, reported it to reception and it was still there 24 hrs later. To be fair to the manager, he did give us complementary continental breakfasts,by way of apology, but i have to say in my opinion you can get a much better hotel in sydney for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever received in my life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They cancelled our room before we even checked in and stated there was nothing they could do for me. I had this room booked for over 8 months and they just cancelled it with no alternative. The service was disgraceful, particulalry from Steven. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone. They made my wedding a particularly painful and stressful occasion and showed no remorse. Don't give them your money ! They don't deserve it !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and apartment”
Reviews.Author: Sue33_10
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded on check in from a 2 bedroom apartment to a 3 bedroom apartment, due to availability. This was enormous and spotlessly clean, with two balconies and a brilliant view over the chinese garden. And yet this was the cheapest apartment we had paid for in Australia on this trip. On day of departure the staff extended our check out time until 12 noon and gave us access to the pool etc until 6pm. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Things have changed”
Reviews.Author: gregdane
Reviews.Content: We first reviewed this hotel back in 2000, having been one of the first guests at this (then) new property- at the time, the building was still being completed- the dishwasher was still sitting in the middle of the kitchen floor but we were willing to give them a chance. We were enchanted with the physical property itself but the staff was far and above anything we'd ever experience in a like-priced hotel. We're sorry to report that this is no longer the case. Very little, if any, money has been put into the property since its opening- the furnishings, carpets, wallpaper and paint, etc. are all looking a bit ratty; staff, some of whom are wonderful, are on the whole a bit too eager to blame the guest for any shortcomings brought to their attention ("Sorry, mate- this keycard must be yours!" Housekeeping, apparently, had left their keycard in the electricity activation pad inside the door and then left for the day. This card would have given us access to any room in the building!) *45 minutes to have ice delivered to the room- no self-service machhines available. *One washer and dryer for all guests to share- and they're slow! * what started as a boutique hotel, and is still advertised that way on may websites, is now according to a staff member, a "...budget hotel." We might stay here again, but we will check other otpions before our return to Sydney this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrNeilG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently on our trip to Sydney and were more than impressed. It was a little bit of a pain tranferring between hotels and elevators to reach the Gym and pool but considering that we where overall satisfied with the room. Location is on the edge of China Town and a walk down dixon street through China Town left us mithered to visit restaraunts but we found this easily avoidable. Darling harbour is only a couple of minutes away and is very pleasent, paddy's market (some great bargains and hassle free) was also within a couple of minutes walk. We also found a very cheap souvenier shop oppisite the exibition centre which is a must for all souveniers. The staff fell over themselves to help out where they could and could only be described as excellent. Room itself was well maintained on a daliy basis, for what we paid we would definatly go again. Slight downside was the distance to circular quay just after the new year celebrations but on other occasions we managed to get taxis reletivley easy. The location is close to the central buisness district and the night life of Sydney, one thing we had a gripe with was the monorail station was closed. In conclusion, we found it quiet, relaxing and well worth the money. If we return to Sydney we would not hesitate in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: chinaflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in november 2005 for 1 day at the start of our holiday and 3 days at the end. Both rooms were more than adequate with microwave, electric hob, toaster etc, but its so near chinatown you wont need to cook. coupled with a short walk to all the restaurants in darling harbour you are set. Its also not far from paddys market and the convention centre. Its possible to get the monorail and is quiet despite being central. The furnishings were up to scratch and the staff were friendly and helpful. One note of warning if you want to park a car overnight its $36. Would i stay there again, sure.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fdpm
Reviews.Content: Arrived early evening and given key to suite only to discover the room not yet made up from previous occupants - moved into suite next door and discover hairs on pillows, curtains missing and toilet seat broken - generally dirty and totally NOT a four star condition! Move again into suite next door which was marginally cleaner. Have to say the staff were extremely helpful and understanding - but I was very disappointed as booked and paid for this accomodation in advance based on photos on expedia - quite shocked at state as have recently stayed in Melbourne Rydges - excellent and Adelaide Pacific - also excellent and both were cheaper by far! I would NOT recommend anyone staying here if they are looking for a classy hotel. I was told they are spending loads of money in the coming months on refurbishment - Can't happen too soon in my opinion. Just sorry I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base to Explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A family of four, we stayed in a spacious two bedroom apartment in June and were very impressed with the standard and cleanliness of the accomodation, the convenience of having a fully equiped kitchen and laundry and the great central location within a few minutes walk of Darling Harbour. Chinatown is also nearby. Our apartment faced the Chinese Gardens across a busy road but we found the place very quiet. We would stay here again and certainly recommend these apartments. The only criticism was that the little service we required from the reception staff was indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at these apartments on a number of occasions and have always found them to be very clean, roomy (kitchen/lounge combined seperate bedroom bath most certainly large enough for two people) & quite modern in design. Since our first stay have noticed a few "need to repair" areas maybe not worth the 4.5 star but still worthy of a 3+. The staff have always been effecient & courteous. The location is fabulous for Darling Harbour & exhibition centre, Paddys market & Chinatown. Short walk to the Light rail which will take you to Star City Casino, & monorail station to the city which unfortunately for our London visitor has always been open on previous occasions. I know it has been over 12mths since our last visit but would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arrived in morning and rooms were not ready, building work going on all around property, walls very thin, could hear everything going on in other apartments. apartment itself ok but deffinately not 4.5 star overlooked construction going on in neighbouring building, very noisy staff agreed more like 2 star, very long corridors and complicated lift system, got lost trying to find pool. monorail station appeared to be closed down. checked out after only 15 minutes and found better accomodation at darling harbour. I would not recommend this hotel/apartments, and would not return

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: OnThePoint
Reviews.Content: Based on the great reviews this hotel has been getting, we stayed here for a night when passing through last week. Quite a disappointment for a number of reasons: 1. The hotel is a VERY long building. The little reception is one end. To get to our room at the other end we had to take an elevator to level 7, then along a corridor, through a building connecting door to another set of elevators then up to our floor then along a very long corridor (not a very appealing one - like a tenement block) to get to the apartment. Just terrible with lots of luggage. 2. The air conditioning was broken down in the hotel and it was a very warm night. 3. The outlook over Chinatown was uninspiring to say the least. Nice view of lots of other people in their apartments though. 4. The apartment, although large, was a maze of small rooms and felt strangely claustrophobic. The kitchen had been cleaned with a smelly cloth and all surfaces needed a full wash down because they stank. 5. The elevator keys stopped working for us in the morning so we couldn't get back to reception since we couldn't do our little transfer at level 7. A real pain with a flight to catch. Based on the apartment we stayed in I couldn't recommend this hotel. Even the location is relatively poor. You're in a noisy part of town (traffic noise and people exiting the Entertainment Centre late at night) and apart from Chinatown and Darling Harbour the main sites are a long walk away. The waterside in Darling Harbour is over 10 mins fast walk, and Darling Harbour is hardly the "real" Sydney that new tourists want to see although it is a reasonably pleasant place. I can only assume that the people who have written the reviews haven't stayed in many other Sydney hotels. I have and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to sleep dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the southern cross executive suites close to darling harbour expecting to find 4 star accomodation as advertised after a very long journey and no sleep. What a shock. building work going on all around property, walls so thin you can hear every noise, apartments small. and basic, not the luxury was expecting, reception confirmed that this property has a 4.5 star rating however even they agreed it was more like a 2 star. meant to have a light rail station on site however this was not open. We booked 2 one bedroomed suites, however only one was available. After 10 minutes we booked out and found more suitable accomodation, I would not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed after reading great reviews”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews of this apartment hotel, we were quite excited to visit. As it turned out, there were several positives, including the apartment's facilities and courteous hotel staff. Also, the location across from Chinatown was a plus. However, there were also some negatives, depending on your apartment location and whether you are sensitive to noise. We stayed there a few weeks ago, and we had a very nice room with balcony facing Chinatown. It seemed like a great location, but it turned out to be very noisy -- traffic from the hotel's location at the intersection of two heavily traveled roads, and street noise (people laughing and shouting) until well past 3am. The hotel staff were able to relocate us to an interior room, and we had no problems with noise after that. The immediate neighborhood is also going through some sort of evolution -- a building across the street is being renovated (construction noise), while the large high-rise building behind the hotel (and shown in the hotel photo) is completely empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Clarion Suites in November 2004 but was very disappointed as there were no facilities at all. The gym and pool were being refurbished although I could use the pool in another hotel close by which was not ideal. The rooms and staff were excellent and ideal for a business trip but not really suitable for tourists. There was no coffee shop, bar or lounge to sit and mix with other people so after sightseeing the only thing to do was sit in the room. As I travel to Australia regularly, usually alone, my next visit would be to a hotel with lots of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation, Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: samraj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights early November this year - location can't get any better! Opposite China Town, shops & restaurants all around and a walking distance to the harbour, even for lazy ones like us travelling with a 3 year old! Highly recommended - good staff for advise.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Slackbladder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a 2 bed apartment. This hotel is great. The rooms are very modern and bright with A/C All mod cons. fully fitted kitchen, microwave, hifi, video Two lavish bathrooms (handy for the four people) and a great big balcony. And rooftop pool and gym too. Location is great. Right next to Paddys Market and Chinatown. Short walk to Darling Harbour. The monorail is literally in the building and the tram is a short walk away. It's within walking distance of central station and hyde park (for buses) The staff were amazing. Always helpful. One night we were going to the opera and wanted to get a taxi to take us there. We were told that at that time (6.30pm) it would be hard to book one as it would be very busy and it was pouring down with rain. So the staff member stood out in the middle of the road to flag one down. Getting himself totally drenched for about 15 minutes until a cab pulled up. That's dedication to service. They also seemlessly booked a tour to the Blue Mountains for us. Which was one of the highlights of the trip. The suites are really in an apartment block shared with renters and owners. The adjacent hotel manages the apartments and they provide the reception staff. Works well.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location for Theatre and Darling Harbour experiences”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great for those requiring some self catering facilities as a small kitchen is in each apartment. Whilst both the studio apartments and 1x bedroom apartments are not huge they are comfortable and o.k. if using here as a base. Unfortuneately we didn't have any views or balconies but the windows could be opened for fresh air.The location is fantastic with the Capitol Theatre, Chinatown (Dixon Street fab eats)Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour all within a few minutes easy walk. A further plus is the monorail station adjacent to the building. (This travels 1x way through Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour- $4 AUD and $2.20 AUD for concession) A few things to watch out for- Requesting things such as smoking and non smoking rooms, and views. Although requests had been made for non smoking, we were advised that requests could not be guaranteed! This may have had something to do with a booking being made online. The reception staff were obliging when alerted to the seriousness of an unfulfilled request. They happily assisted in organising pre arrival bookings for airport shuttle service and a highly regarded babysitter. This esablishment's strength is its location and a car is not necessary if its just a Sydney and locale visit. At a cheap internet or last minute rate it represents good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mactollcross
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent apartment in a great location. It is close to all Darling harbour has to offer and within reasonable walking distance to Circular quay, although busses are also frequent.It has a monorail station also. The room is all you need with cooking facilities and an ordering service for food deliveries but with so many great resturants close by why stay in?? The decor is browns and grey- modern style, Views are typical city views - other apartments & Chinatown. Cockle bay wharf and harbourside minutes walk away. The staff were excellent and attended to our faulty air conditioning very quickly. All in all we will go there again and would recomend it to anyone

HotelInfo.Name: Seasons Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 38 Harbour St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Clarion Suites)
